page.title: 12Cliffe Fair
page.content: Cliffe Fair is held on the third Sunday in June on the playing field. It is organised by the{clubs}in the village. It starts with a parade of decorated floats through the village, and there is a fancy dress competition and other stalls, competitions and displays. Often there is the Coal Board Castle, like a big air bed in the shape of a castle that you can bounce on. The money that is raised is shared out among the clubs in the village. This year, 1985, over Â£700 was raised. The Village Institute and Playing Field got Â£180 each, the Women's Institute, Youth Club, Tennis Club and playgroup got Â£50 each, and another eight clubs or groups each received Â£20.
